title: Martinique - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: Police Forces of France (2017-) Prison Guards Martinique

On 3 February 2021, in Ducos, Le Marin, about 100 prison guards blocked access to the site in protest against working conditions and the poor health conditions in the prison amidst the coronavirus pandemic. [size=about 100]

On 3 February 2021, in Fort-de-France, Fort-de-France, workers of the Colas utilities contractor blocked access to the commercial port in protest over the dismissal of 28 of their colleagues. [size=no report]

On 31 January 2021, in Fort-de-France, Fort-de-France, hundreds of people protested to call on authorities to allow the holding of the carnival this year. Carnival has been downscaled this year because of the coronavirus. Many protesters wore balaclavas to conceal their identities. [size=hundreds]

On 23 January 2021, in Le Morne-Rouge, Sainte-Pierre, several dozen activists of various unions, as well as activists affiliated with Greenpeace and other organizations protested against recent legal proceedings regarding the use of the Chlordecone pesticide on the island. [size=several dozen]

On 11 January 2021, in Fort-de-France, Fort-de-France, more than 200 fishermen protested in the city centre against a new decree which changed some safety standards for boating equipment, as result of which some fishermen were fined. The fishermen also protested to demand changes to their pension funds. The protest ended when the speaker of the cabinet agreed to meet with representatives. [size=more than 200]

On 9 November 2020, in Fort-de-France, Martinique, dozens of protesters of the RVN group gathered outside the courthouse during a court hearing of an activist who allegedly attacked a police officer during a protest. [size=dozens]

On 7 November 2020, in Fort-de-France, Fort-de-France, about 30 people including members of the RVN separatist movement protested to demand more justice and against the use of coronavirus masks. [size=about 30]

On 7 November 2020, in Fort-de-France, Fort-de-France, more than 300 people protested to demand that the government recognize the impact of the pesticide chlordecone on the health of the population. [size=more than 300]

On 31 October 2020, in Fort-de-France, Fort-de-France, about 30 people protested outside the town hall against the mandatory wearing of masks in supermarkets to prevent the spread of coronavirus. Later more than 120 protesters gathered at the La Savane seaside park to protest against masks. [size=150]

On 7 September 2020, in Fort de France, Fort de France, protesters gathered in front the courthouse to protest and support an activist who was on trial for releasing a video montage accusing a police officers of violence during a demonstration. [size=no report]
On 5 September 2020, in Cluny, Fort de France, protesters mobilized against the use of a chemical in agriculture which they say poisons the population of the island. [size=no report]
On 27 August 2020, in Fort-de-France, Fort-de-France, several dozen people took to the streets to voice their support for four activist who were being tried. [size=several dozen]
On 25 July 2020, in Fort-de-France, rioters tore down two statues of historic, colonial figures and damaged them with sledgehammers. [size=no report]

On 24 July 2020, in Fort-de-France, 20 health workers of the university hospital staged a walk out and protested against the verbal abuse and racist remarks they have been suffering for the past weeks. [size=20]

On 22 July 2020, in Fort-de-France, several hundred people gathered to protest against the police who hardhandedly arrested a man days earlier. Protesters also demanded the government to solve a problem related to soil poisoning on the island. [size=several hundred]

On 20 July 2020, in Fort-de-France, protesters of the nationalist and separatist Red-Green-Black movement protested at the university hospital following the arrest of a man days before. Nurses later complained that the protesters were verbally abusing them. [size=no report]
On 18 July 2020, in Fort-de-France, protesters of the nationalist and separatist Red-Green-Black movement protested following the arrest of a man two days before. [size=no report]

On 17 July 2020, in Fort-de-France, protesters of the nationalist and separatist Red-Green-Black movement protested following the arrest of a man the day before. While talking to the mayor one of the protesters put a chain - similar to those used on slaves in the past - around the mayor's waist. [size=no report]
On 16 July 2020, in Fort-de-France (Fort-de-France), protesters gathered to oppose the detention of two people who allegedly attacked against police officers on 15 May 2020. [size=no report]

On 16 June 2020, in Fort-de-France, health workers took to the streets to protest against various measures, for more resources and renegotiation of wages. This was part of a protest movement organized throughout France. [size=no report]
On 6 June 2020, in Fort-de-France, 500 people protested in solidarity with the Black Lives Matter movement. [size=500]

On 3 June 2020, in Fort-de-France, 200 people protested in the street in support of seven activists that are on trial for violence. The protesters also took a minute of silence as a gesture of Black Lives Matter in solidarity of the protests happening in the United States. The trial was not held in the end. [size=200]

On 29 May 2020, in Fort-de-France, around 20 farmers gathered outside the Union House and then drove in their cars to the Collectivite Territoriale de la Martinique. The farmers protested in favour of land reform in Martinique to reduce dependence on import of food products, as well as less use of pesticides in order to protect the environment. [size=no report]

On 22 May 2020, in Fort-de-France, unknown individuals destroyed two statues of French abolitionist Victor Schoelcher. While the motivation for the act is unknown, the destruction of the abolitionists on the National Commemoration of the Abolition of Slavery in France (22 May) led to comments condemning that act in Martinique. [size=no report]
On 20 May 2020, in Fort-de-France, a hundred citizens protested against the unreliable water access that they have been dealing with. [size=a hundred]

On 18 May 2020, in Sainte-Luce, Le Marin, members of the Southern Citizens Collective protested against water cuts on the island. Water access in the southern part of Martinique has been unreliable for weeks. [size=no report]
On 20 February 2020 in Fort-de-France, several thousands of people protested against pension and school reform. Many were students and education employees. [size=several thousand]
On 11 February 2020, in Lamentin, around fifty nurses gathered in front of the social security offices to protest the pension and school reform. [size=around 50]

On 11 February 2020, on the road between Le Lamentin and Fort-de-France, there was a drive-slow action where about thirty cars took over two lanes of the road, slowing down traffic to protest the pension and school reform. [size=around 30]

On 07 February 2020, in Fort-de-France, over 300 protesters affiliated with the national education union gathered to protest the pension and school reform. More protesters joined them as they marched. [size=over 300]

On 03 February 2020 in Sainte-Marie, close to 200 teachers participated in a general assembly and then marched through the streets, protesting pension reform. Many teachers have been striking for a month, and many schools are closed. [size=almost 200]
On 31 January 2020 in Fort-de-France, over 300 workers in the national education system protested in support of the movement against pension reform. [size=over 300]
On 24 January 2020 in Fort-de-France, 2500 people marched protesting pension and school reforms, among them 1300 students and school workers. [size=2500]
On 20 January 2020 in Fort-de-France, over 200 nurses staged a protest against pension reform, marching the streets towards the regional Health Agency. [size=over 200]

On 17 January 2020 in Fort-de-France, several dozens of lawyers staged a protest against a pension reform, hanging up their robes on the railings and singing protest songs at the courthouse. [size=several dozens]

On 13 January 2020 in Fort-de-France, over 100 people demonstrated at the courthouse where a case against seven anti-chlordecone activists was held. Some dozens of them clashed with the police, throwing bottles, Molotov cocktails, and stones at the police, who answered with teargas. [size=over 100]
On 09 January 2020 in Fort-de-France, between 1500 and 5000 protesters, among them students, marched against pension reforms. [size=1500-5000]

On 10 December 2019 in Fort-de-France, between 1700 and 3000 people protested, at the call of the main unions, against the pension reform proposed by the French government. The organizers reported more than 3000 protesters while the prefecture reported 1700. [size=between 1700 and 3000]
On 09 December 2019 in Fort-de-France, members of the FO: Force Ouvriere union protested against pension reform by blocking the headquarters of the General Social Security Fund. [size=no report]
On 05 December 2019 in Fort-de-France, about 5000 people, at the call of all the main unions, protested against the pension reform proposed by the French government. [size=about 5000]

On 23 November 2019 in Le Robert, demonstrators and police clashed outside a closed down hypermarket. The demonstrators, some masked, demand compensation for the use of chlordecone and paraquat on plantations. [size=no report]
On 20 November 2019 in Fort-de-France, there was a protest for better quality of drinking water in Martinique. [size=no report]

On November 16, 2019, in Genipa, Riviere-Salee, a small group protested outside a supermarket against its owners_use of the insecticide chlordecone (kepone). The police stopped the protesters from reaching the entrance to the supermarket. [size=no report]
On October 2, 2019, in Fort-de-France, various tens of police officers protested against insecurity and demanded better work conditions. [size=tens]
CGT: General Confederation of Labour; Labour Group (Martinique)

On September 24, 2019, in Fort-de-France, over 500 workers participated in a protest, organized by the CGT, against the government_ social and economic policies, specifically the pension reform. [size=over 500]

On September 04, 2029, a group of police officers of the Brigade Anti-Criminalite (BAC) were trapped and ambushed in the quartier de Langeviller-Bellevue in Fort-de-France (Ravine-Vilaine) by a group of young men who threw stones and glass bottles on police vehicles, which partially damaged them. The police were called to the area following the outbreak of a dispute between a group of young men. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.
On August 17, 2019, a protest against violence was held in Fort de France, with a few tens of people attending. [size=tens]
Police Forces of France (2017-) Prison Guards Martinique

On 4 July 2019, supervisors at the prison Ducos, Le Marin, blocked the accesses in and out of the prison, and went on strike to protest to the Ministry of Justice regarding the distribution of drugs to the prisoners, which had led to violence between prisoners. [size=no report]
On June 26, 2019, in Vauclin, Martinique, a dozen local residents protested against plans to construct a gas station in their neighbourhood. [size=dozens]
On April 4 2019, teachers protested at the Brasserie Lorraine roundabout in Le Lamentin, Fort-de-France, Martinique, against the proposed education reform. [size=unknown]
On January 21 2019, women in Ducos, Martinique, marched the streets to denounce violence against women. [size=no report]
On January 14 2019, lawyers in Fort-de-France, Martinique, protested against proposed justice reform. [size=no report]

On 20 December 2018, young people and members of an association demonstrated in front of a hotel in Plateau-Roy. They are against the modalities of selections for the choice of a hymn and a flag for Martinique. Since it was denied their access to a plenary that was in progress, demonstrators decided to burn the banner announcing the contest flag and anthem.
On 14 December 2018, high school students maintain their mobilization against the education reforms in the Saint-Pierre, La Trinite, Fort-de-France, and Le Marin areas of Martinique.
On 14 December 2018, high school students maintain their mobilization against the education reforms in the Saint-Pierre, La Trinite, Fort-de-France, and Le Marin areas of Martinique.
On 14 December 2018, high school students maintain their mobilization against the education reforms in the Saint-Pierre, La Trinite, Fort-de-France, and Le Marin areas of Martinique.
On 14 December 2018, high school students maintain their mobilization against the education reforms in the Saint-Pierre, La Trinite, Fort-de-France, and Le Marin areas of Martinique.

On 13 December 2018, students of Martinique continued their mobilization against certain reforms in education. Several high schools were blocked or disturbed in Fort-de-France, Lamentin, La Trinite, Ducos, Lorrain, Marin, Riviere-Salee and at Sainte-Marie.

On 13 December 2018, students of Martinique continued their mobilization against certain reforms in education. Several high schools were blocked or disturbed in Fort-de-France, Lamentin, La Trinite, Ducos, Lorrain, Marin, Riviere-Salee and at Sainte-Marie.

On 13 December 2018, students of Martinique continued their mobilization against certain reforms in education. Several high schools were blocked or disturbed in Fort-de-France, Lamentin, La Trinite, Ducos, Lorrain, Marin, Riviere-Salee and at Sainte-Marie.

On 13 December 2018, students of Martinique continued their mobilization against certain reforms in education. Several high schools were blocked or disturbed in Fort-de-France, Lamentin, La Trinite, Ducos, Lorrain, Marin, Riviere-Salee and at Sainte-Marie.

On 13 December 2018, students of Martinique continued their mobilization against certain reforms in education. Several high schools were blocked or disturbed in Fort-de-France, Lamentin, La Trinite, Ducos, Lorrain, Marin, Riviere-Salee and at Sainte-Marie.

On 13 December 2018, students of Martinique continued their mobilization against certain reforms in education. Several high schools were blocked or disturbed in Fort-de-France, Lamentin, La Trinite, Ducos, Lorrain, Marin, Riviere-Salee and at Sainte-Marie.

On 13 December 2018, students of Martinique continued their mobilization against certain reforms in education. Several high schools were blocked or disturbed in Fort-de-France, Lamentin, La Trinite, Ducos, Lorrain, Marin, Riviere-Salee and at Sainte-Marie.

On 13 December 2018, students of Martinique continued their mobilization against certain reforms in education. Several high schools were blocked or disturbed in Fort-de-France, Lamentin, La Trinite, Ducos, Lorrain, Marin, Riviere-Salee and at Sainte-Marie.

On 12 December 2018, high schools students took the street to protest in Fort-de-France and in Riviere-Salee against the baccalaureate reform. Classes were paralyzed and Martinique establishments are disturbed.

On 12 December 2018, high schools students took the street to protest in Fort-de-France and in Riviere-Salee against the baccalaureate reform. Classes were paralyzed and Martinique establishments are disturbed.

On 8 December 2018, fifty people went to the biggest shopping center on the island, in Le Lamentin, Martinique before demonstrating on foot on the highway. They demand a reduction in the prices of certain basic products, such as fuel and food, that they consider to be unfair and a revaluation of low wages.

On 1 December 2018, rioters marched in the city center and blocked a roundabout near the prefecture in Fort-de-France in Martinique. They demand a reduction in the prices deemed unfair of certain basic products, such as fuel and food and a revaluation of low wages.
On 17 November 2018, a group of people from the yellow vest movement protested in Fort-de-France against the increase in taxes and to demand improvements in the social conditions.
On 10 November 2018, workers from the bus company Mozaik in Fort-de-France protested against the dismissal of one of their co-workers.
On 7 November 2018, parents of the students from The Mountain school in Le Vauclin blocked the entrance of the school to demand the transfer of their children to other schools.
On 31 October 2018, a group of people protested against the presence in Martinique of the far-right deputy Florian Philippot.
On 8 October 2018, residents from Volga neighborhood in Fort-de-France blocked the roads to reinforce the measure that forbids trucks to circulate around the neighborhood.
On 27 September 2018, unionist marches in Fort-de-France during the visit of the President of the Republic to protest against the decrease in the pensions and on the purchasing power.

On 26 September 2018, an environmental group known as the Desperate from Ponthalery blocked a route in Le Robert bringing the electronic devices that have been damaged by the sargassum seaweed to show the problems that this can cause to health.

On 23 September 2018, a group of representatives from different environmental organizations blocked a rural road in Sainte-Marie to demonstrate against the attempts of appropriation of this road by l'habitation Luciole. The police intervened to lift the blockages.
CGT: General Confederation of Labour; Labour Group (Martinique)
On 20 September 2018, public officers marched to the offices of the CTM to demand their inclusion in the negotiations to re-establish the classes at the schools after the strikes that they initiated.
On 20 September 2018, students from the Place D'Armes school in Lamentin blocked the entrance of the school to protest against the lack of surveillance and the problems with their common dining room.
CGT: General Confederation of Labour; Labour Group (Martinique)
On 19 September 2018, public officers affiliated to CGT protested in front of different schools of Martinique against the reductions of posts and demanding improvements in their work conditions.
CGT: General Confederation of Labour; Labour Group (Martinique)
On 18 September 2018, public officers affiliated to CGT protested in front of different schools of Martinique against the reductions of posts and demanding improvements in their work conditions.
CGT: General Confederation of Labour; Labour Group (Martinique)

On 17 September 2018, public agents affiliated to the CGT erected barricades at the secondary schools in Sainte-Marie, Lamentin and Fort-de-France to demonstrate against the denial of renewal of their contract.
CGT: General Confederation of Labour; Labour Group (Martinique)

On 17 September 2018, public agents affiliated to the CGT erected barricades at the secondary schools in Sainte-Marie, Lamentin and Fort-de-France to demonstrate against the denial of renewal of their contract.
CGT: General Confederation of Labour; Labour Group (Martinique)

On 17 September 2018, public agents affiliated to the CGT erected barricades at the secondary schools in Sainte-Marie, Lamentin and Fort-de-France to demonstrate against the refusal to renew their contract.
CGT: General Confederation of Labour; Labour Group (Martinique)
On 16 September 2018, public officers affiliated to CGT protested in front of different schools of Martinique against the reductions of posts and demanding improvements in their work conditions.
CGT: General Confederation of Labour; Labour Group (Martinique)
On 15 September 2018, public officers affiliated to CGT protested in front of different schools of Martinique against the reductions of posts and demanding improvements in their work conditions.
CGT: General Confederation of Labour; Labour Group (Martinique)
On 14 September 2018, public officers affiliated to CGT protested in front of different schools of Martinique against the reductions of posts and demanding improvements in their work conditions.
On 28 August 2018, prisoners in Ducos participated in violent confrontations caused by cohabitation problems and the trafficking of illegal goods within the prison.
On 27 August 2018, prisoners in Ducos participated in violent confrontations caused by cohabitation problems and the trafficking of illegal goods within the prison.
On 26 August 2018, prisoners in Ducos participated in violent confrontations caused by cohabitation problems and the trafficking of illegal goods within the prison.
On 25 August 2018, prisoners in Ducos participated in violent confrontations caused by cohabitation problems and the trafficking of illegal goods within the prison.
On 29 July 2018, taxi drivers protested in Fort-de-France airport against the prohibitions of using an area in the airport for their service.
On 4 July 2018, 500 physiotherapists protested in Fort-de-France against the license that will allow chiropractors to do some procedures that should be only authorized to physiotherapists
On 12 June 2018, members of the movements Save the Health of Martinique protested on the roads of Fort-de-France against the lack of resources and the poor conditions of the public hospitals.

On 9 June 2018, after a protest against the direction of the Carrefour market in Ducos a group of people marched to the city hall in Fort-de-France and threw bags filled with sargassum seaweeds. The Police dispersed the protest using tear gas.

On 25 May 2018, a group of people protested in Ducos against the group that currently is leading the Carrefour market in the country. The police was present during the protest but did not cause any interruption.
CGT: General Confederation of Labour; Labour Group (Martinique)
On 9 May 2018, workers affiliated to the CGT from the service station Vito Lareinty in Lamentin blocked the access to pumps and to the shop to demand improvements in their work conditions.
CGT: General Confederation of Labour; Labour Group (Martinique)
On 8 May 2018, workers affiliated to the CGT from the service station Vito Lareinty in Lamentin blocked the access to pumps and to the shop to demand improvements in their work conditions.

On 26 March 2018, students from the Antilles University from the Schoelcher campus blocked the access to the university to protest against the return of teachers that were involved in the Cereigma case.
On 22 March 2018, 1500 members from different unions marched in Fort-de-France against the government's policy that degrades the public service.
UGT: General Union of Workers; Labour Group (Martinique)
On 12 March 2018, members of different union, notably UGT, marched in Fort-de-France to demand improvements in their work conditions.
On 12 March 2018, transport workers (members of different unions) protested in Martinique to demand improvements in their salaries.
On 11 March 2018, transport workers (members of different unions) protested in Martinique to demand improvements in their salaries.
On 10 March 2018, members of the unions and students protested in Fort-de-France against the embezzlement of university funds.
UNSA: National Union of Autonomous Trade Unions; Labour Group (Martinique)

On 1 March 2018, workers from the Bellevue and Perrinon school in Fort-de-France, affiliated to the UNSA: National Union of Autonomous Trade Unions protested in front of the director office against the reduction of posts.
On 21 February 2018, residents from Grande Riviere blocked the bridge that gives entrance to the city to protest against the problems with water service.
Police Forces of France (2017-) Prison Guards Martinique
On 15 January 2018, surveillants from Ducos prison blocked the extraction of prisoners to demand better work conditions considering the cases of aggression that others have suffered.
